intro: Cristaria dissecta, commonly known as the dissected crista, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in shaded woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
